title: Antietam National Battlefield: Park Home
body: The Bloodiest One Day Battle in American History  23,000 soldiers were killed, wounded or missing after twelve hours of savage combat on September 17, 1862. The Battle of Antietam ended the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia's first invasion into the North and led to Abraham Lincoln's issuance of the preliminary Emancipation Proclamation.                Learn About the Battle   Here you will find more information on the history of the Battle of Antietam as well as links to our Cultural and Natural Resources.        Plan Your Visit   Check out this section for answers to all your questions if you are planning a visit to Antietam National Battlefield.              Burnside Bridge Restoration   Check here for updates on the restoration of the Burnside Bridge.        Social Media   Follow us on your favorite social media site.
